column4: hi! I have a crashed system because I tried to upgrade from dapper to edgy. Now, is there any way I can save my files? Recovery mode does not work
i have crashed my system doesn't tell us much info about what's actually wrong

the thing is. After my upgrade I had several errors and the system didn't want to accept my password. And at reboot the system didn't restart and stops and gives me a black screen. No grub. I can't even reach it from my live boot cd because I don't have permission
why did it require your password after the upgrade?
I have no idea... I upgrade it when I was asleep and it said that it wanted my password so I just entered it and it tells me it's the wrong pass
what asked you for a password and what was the message?
the update manager asked me for password
try to bit a bit less ambiguous.  its not fun to try to guess what is going on with your system.  you have to tell us the specifics
and at that point you rebooted?

alright, Well. I do rememeber that it said something about an error but I ignored it and continued. When I was back I typed my password in and it failed. I checked my update manager and it said I had something wrong which I could fix with dpkg --status -a or something, but it didn't work since it didn't want to accept my password. So I went in to this irc channel and they said I'd probably reboot and start recovery mode. Noth
was this a major upgrade?
yes
and can you mount the filesystem from the install cd?
so I have kinda given up hope for upgrading. And now I want to save my files
no. 1 sec
use sudo in front of your command
I've already tried that
sudo cp .....
sudo cp /target/home/tobbe/* /media/Volume/
yes.  a better command woudl be sudo rsync -av /target/home/tobbe /media//Volume/
seems to work, can't really determine that yet, i'm copying 15 gig...
I don't know if you have time. But since you helped me before. Please check this link: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=1694796#post1694796
